1.brief: strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
avengement, whether the act of the passion
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
avengement, whether the act of the passion

2.brief: to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
treatment, i.e. an act (of good or ill); by implication, service or requital
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

3.brief: as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
properly, extent (of time); but used only adverbially (especially with other particle prefixes), when (either relative or interrogative)
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
properly, extent (of time); but used only adverbially (especially with other particle prefixes), when (either relative or interrogative)
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
to jump for joy, i.e. exult

4.brief: to gush forth; figuratively, to utter (good or bad words); specifically, to emit (a foul odor)
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol

5.brief: a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to crumble; transitively, to bruise (literally or figuratively)
properly, something inherited, i.e. (abstractly) occupancy, or (concretely) an heirloom; generally an estate, patrimony or portion
to depress literally or figuratively, transitive or intransitive (in various applications, as follows)

6.brief: a widow; also a desolate place
properly, a guest; by implication, a foreigner
properly, to dash in pieces, i.e. kill (a human being), especially to murder

7.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

8.brief: to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand
to kindle, i.e. consume (by fire or by eating);  to be(-come) brutish
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
properly, fat, i.e. (figuratively) stupid or silly
properly, extent (of time); but used only adverbially (especially with other particle prefixes), when (either relative or interrogative)
to be (causatively, make or act) circumspect and hence, intelligent

9.brief: properly, to strike in, i.e. fix; specifically, to plant (literally or figuratively)
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to mould into a form; especially as apotter; figuratively, to determine (i.e. form a resolution)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to scan, i.e. look intently at; by implication, to regard with pleasure, favor or care

10.brief: to chastise, literally (with blows) or figuratively (with words); hence, to instruct
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be right (i.e. correct); reciprocal, to argue; causatively, to decide, justify or convict
properly, to goad, i.e. (by implication) to teach (the rod being an Oriental incentive)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)

11.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
a contrivance, i.e. (concretely) a texture, machine, or (abstractly) intention, plan (whether bad, a plot; or good, advice)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
emptiness or vanity; figuratively, something transitory and unsatisfactory; often used as an adverb

12.brief: happiness; only in masculine plural construction as interjection, how happy!
properly, a valiant man or warrior; generally, a person simply
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to chastise, literally (with blows) or figuratively (with words); hence, to instruct
a precept or statute, especially the Decalogue or Pentateuch
properly, to goad, i.e. (by implication) to teach (the rod being an Oriental incentive)

13.brief: a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
properly, to dig; figuratively, to plot; generally, to bore or open
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
a pit (especially as a trap); figuratively, destruction

not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to pound, i.e. smite; by implication (as if beating out, and thus expanding) to disperse; also, to thrust off, down, out or upon (inclusively, reject, let alone, permit, remit, etc.)

the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
properly, the hind part; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, after (in various senses)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

16.brief: who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
properly, to spoil (literally, by breaking to pieces); figuratively, to make (or be) good fornothing, i.e. bad (physically, socially or morally)
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to place (any thing so as to stay); reflexively, to station, offer, continue

to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol

a little or few (often adverbial or compar.)
to reside or permanently stay (literally or figuratively)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
